title: Behavior of a function defined as an integral

content.question: Let g be a function with first derivative given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mi>g</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mi>x</mi> </msubsup> <mrow> <msup> <mi>e</mi> <mrow> <mo>−</mo><msup> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> </msup> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4505@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. Which of the following must be true on the interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>2</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3A6F@</annotation> </semantics> </math>?

choices.label: g is increasing, and the graph of g is concave up.
g is increasing, and the graph of g is concave down.
g is decreasing, and the graph of g is concave up.
g is decreasing, and the graph of g is concave down.

g is decreasing, and the graph of g has a point of inflection on <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>2</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3A6F@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

content.answer: g is increasing, and the graph of g is concave up.

topic.text: 6.4: The Fundamental Theorem of Calculus and Accumulation Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
